topic.title: Explain: "Used: x kilobytes / limit"
topic.body: Hi all - could someone please explain to me the basics behind the usage limits that we see here on ZeroTalk?  I'm wondering 1) how is your usage limit calculated/determined and 2) can one increase it and if so how?  A reference image: http://imgur.com/ZCiPtFP

2_1KJFB4SEHaHCY11HMKsMGyth1mXKb3R5oY.body: Would someone mind doing a comparison of what we've got so far?  I've seen this one that's linked above, zerosearch, kaffeine, etc and I'm not quite sure which is the best choice to use/recommend.  Appreciate it :D

> [ripper234](#comment_1_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL): Integrate it into Zeronet homepage!
> Also, pagerank.
> https://medium.com/world-bug-repository/zerosearch-a-google-for-the-decentralized-web-b940ee66d9f3#.qng13v1fi
> Also, are you looking for investors?

I truly hope ZeroNet can eventually have something akin to what this article outlines.  Thanks for the good read :)

1_1BGaNcH1UBqAdatPbT3YssmPRVdhepMNPW.body: Any chance at building functionality to enable a "VPN mode" that simply hides the warnings about Tor not being configured or functional (both in the console and on the interface)?  As a VPN is an arguably more secure alternative to Tor, I think it's safe to assume that such a feature would be worthwhile.  It could be a toggle on the main interface in the same dropdown as the update, shutdown, etc for ZeroNet.

1_1MhL8nWAcuB5YxbhyYgEHNvsToUtQutRVs.body:
Okay, well I found this explanation (after noticing that there was indeed a tooltip): http://imgur.com/VEd0udc

But, I guess all I'm wondering now is who to contact if/when you run out?  I joined ZeroNet today and I'm already at USED: 4.1K/40K :D

> [ekaterina](#comment_75_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD): nofish, he is the owner of this site and the creator of ZeroNet. There will also be a message next to the display of the limit telling you to contact him when you reach 80% or so of the limit. So when the time comes you can just write him a quick ZeroMail, I did that a couple of days ago and got my limit raised.

Awesome; thanks for the help!

1_19KjJXTkb6bLafLJsfVBf5v127H4RYKABM.body:
Have you considered using a VPN?  The best free one I can recommend is: https://www.betternet.co/

Currently they have a desktop app for Windows (that works great) with one for Mac coming soon.
Here - CNET has their official mirror: http://download.cnet.com/Betternet/3000-2144_4-76276273.html

4_1ADB7TdX2fVbTsWBoMe9yBTmVXTbb33b4R.body: This is a great thread!  Post more :D
